description: Returns a list of DataSource that match the search criteria in the request.

parameters.name: FilterVariable
parameters.description: Use one of the following variables to filter a list of DataSource: CreatedAt - Sets the search criteria to DataSource creation dates. Status - Sets the search criteria to DataSource statuses. Name - Sets the search criteria to the contents of DataSource Name. DataUri - Sets the search criteria to the URI of data files used to create the DataSource. The URI can identify either a file or an Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) bucket or directory. IAMUser - Sets the search criteria to the user account that invoked the DataSource creation.

parameters.name: Prefix
parameters.description: A string that is found at the beginning of a variable, such as Name or Id. For example, a DataSource could have the Name 2014-09-09-HolidayGiftMailer. To search for this DataSource, select Name for the FilterVariable and any of the following strings for the Prefix: 2014-09 2014-09-09 2014-09-09-Holiday.

parameters.name: SortOrder
parameters.description: A two-value parameter that determines the sequence of the resulting list of DataSource. asc - Arranges the list in ascending order (A-Z, 0-9). dsc - Arranges the list in descending order (Z-A, 9-0). Results are sorted by FilterVariable.

nested_items.name: Results
nested_items.description: A list of DataSource that meet the search criteria.

nested_items.name: DataSourceId
nested_items.description: The ID that is assigned to the DataSource during creation.

nested_items.name: DataLocationS3
nested_items.description: The location and name of the data in Amazon Simple Storage Service (Amazon S3) that is used by a DataSource.

nested_items.name: DataRearrangement
nested_items.description: A JSON string that represents the splitting and rearrangement requirement used when this DataSource was created.

nested_items.name: CreatedByIamUser
nested_items.description: The AWS user account from which the DataSource was created. The account type can be either an AWS root account or an AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) user account.

nested_items.name: CreatedAt
nested_items.description: The time that the DataSource was created. The time is expressed in epoch time.

nested_items.name: LastUpdatedAt
nested_items.description: The time of the most recent edit to the BatchPrediction. The time is expressed in epoch time.

nested_items.name: DataSizeInBytes
nested_items.description: The total number of observations contained in the data files that the DataSource references.

nested_items.name: NumberOfFiles
nested_items.description: The number of data files referenced by the DataSource.

nested_items.name: Name
nested_items.description: A user-supplied name or description of the DataSource.

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: The current status of the DataSource. This element can have one of the following values:
PENDING - Amazon Machine Learning (Amazon ML) submitted a request to create a DataSource.
INPROGRESS - The creation process is underway.
FAILED - The request to create a DataSource did not run to completion. It is not usable.
COMPLETED - The creation process completed successfully.
DELETED - The DataSource is marked as deleted. It is not usable.

nested_items.name: Message
nested_items.description: A description of the most recent details about creating the DataSource.

nested_items.name: RedshiftMetadata
nested_items.description: Describes the DataSource details specific to Amazon Redshift.

nested_items.name: RedshiftDatabase
nested_items.description: Describes the database details required to connect to an Amazon Redshift database.

nested_items.name: DatabaseName
nested_items.description: The name of a database hosted on an Amazon Redshift cluster.

nested_items.name: ClusterIdentifier
nested_items.description: The ID of an Amazon Redshift cluster.

nested_items.name: DatabaseUserName
nested_items.description: A username to be used by Amazon Machine Learning (Amazon ML)to connect to a database on an Amazon Redshift cluster. The username should have sufficient permissions to execute the RedshiftSelectSqlQuery query. The username should be valid for an Amazon Redshift USER.

nested_items.name: SelectSqlQuery
nested_items.description: The SQL query that is specified during  CreateDataSourceFromRedshift. Returns only if Verbose is true in GetDataSourceInput.

nested_items.name: RDSMetadata
nested_items.description: The datasource details that are specific to Amazon RDS.

nested_items.name: InstanceIdentifier
nested_items.description: The ID of an RDS DB instance.

nested_items.name: DatabaseName
nested_items.description: The name of a database hosted on an RDS DB instance.

nested_items.name: DatabaseUserName
nested_items.description: The username to be used by Amazon ML to connect to database on an Amazon RDS instance. The username should have sufficient permissions to execute an RDSSelectSqlQuery query.

nested_items.name: SelectSqlQuery
nested_items.description: The SQL query that is supplied during  CreateDataSourceFromRDS. Returns only if Verbose is true in GetDataSourceInput.

nested_items.name: ResourceRole
nested_items.description: The role (DataPipelineDefaultResourceRole) assumed by an Amazon EC2 instance to carry out the copy task from Amazon RDS to Amazon S3. For more information, see Role templates for data pipelines.

nested_items.name: ServiceRole
nested_items.description: The role (DataPipelineDefaultRole) assumed by the Data Pipeline service to monitor the progress of the copy task from Amazon RDS to Amazon S3. For more information, see Role templates for data pipelines.

nested_items.name: DataPipelineId
nested_items.description: The ID of the Data Pipeline instance that is used to carry to copy data from Amazon RDS to Amazon S3. You can use the ID to find details about the instance in the Data Pipeline console.

nested_items.name: RoleARN
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of an AWS IAM Role, such as the following: arn:aws:iam::account:role/rolename.

nested_items.name: ComputeStatistics
nested_items.description: The parameter is true if statistics need to be generated from the observation data.

nested_items.name: ComputeTime
nested_items.description: Long integer type that is a 64-bit signed number.

nested_items.name: FinishedAt
nested_items.description: A timestamp represented in epoch time.

nested_items.name: StartedAt
nested_items.description: A timestamp represented in epoch time.

nested_items.name: NextToken
nested_items.description: An ID of the next page in the paginated results that indicates at least one more page follows.
